channel.title: CVE Feed for Microchip -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microchip -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-30212|2024-09-06T17:46:22.690Z -- microchip -- mplab%C2%AE%20harmony%203%20core%20module
item.description:
If a SCSI READ(10) command is initiated via USB using the largest LBA (0xFFFFFFFF) with it's default block size of 512 and a count of 1,
the first 512 byte of the 0x80000000 memory area is returned to the user. If the block count is increased, the full RAM can be exposed.
The same method works to write to this memory area. If RAM contains pointers, those can be - depending on the application - overwritten to
return data from any other offset including Progam and Boot Flash.

item.title: CVE-2024-4760|2024-08-01T20:47:41.757Z -- microchip -- same70
item.description: A voltage glitch during the startup of EEFC NVM controllers on Microchip SAM E70/S70/V70/V71 microcontrollers allows access to the memory bus via the debug interface even if the security bit is set.
